block.p: Carey Beth Alpert, a daughter of Helaine and David J. Alpert of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening to Jared Brett Spitalnick, a son of Andrea and Dennis Spitalnick of Old Westbury, N.Y. Rabbi Michael A. White officiated at the New York Palace Hotel in Manhattan.
The bride and bridegroom, both lawyers, graduated from the University of Michigan and received their law degrees from New York Law School, where they met.

Carey Beth Alpert, a daughter of Helaine and David J. Alpert of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening to Jared Brett Spitalnick, a son of Andrea and Dennis Spitalnick of Old Westbury, N.Y. Rabbi Michael A. White officiated at the New York Palace Hotel in Manhattan.

Carey Beth Alpert, a daughter of Helaine and David J. Alpert of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening to Jared Brett Spitalnick, a son of Andrea and Dennis Spitalnick of Old Westbury, N.Y. Rabbi Michael A. White officiated at the New York Palace Hotel in Manhattan.
The bride and bridegroom, both lawyers, graduated from the University of Michigan and received their law degrees from New York Law School, where they met.

Mrs. Spitalnick, 30, is an assistant district attorney in Kew Gardens, Queens; she prosecutes cases in the criminal courts. Her father is a partner and the executive vice president of Kellogg Properties, a real estate investment company in Manhattan. Her mother is a lawyer in Scarsdale.

Mr. Spitalnick, 27, is an associate in the Manhattan office of O'Melveny & Myers, the Los Angeles law firm. His mother is a real estate broker at the Coldwell Banker Residential Brokerage in Roslyn Heights, N.Y. His father is the managing partner and an owner of Derian Apparel, a maker of fitness and sports apparel in Manhattan.
